intro: Pachypterygium afghanicum, commonly known as the Afghan spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia, particularly Afghanistan. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by colorful bracts that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
